info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A line of showers and thunderstorms near the M-46 corridor... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from Peck to near Frankenmuth to near St. Charles. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and wind gusts around 30 mph. A brief funnel cloud is also possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding of prone areas is possible. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Showers and thunderstorms will be near... Applegate around 630 PM EDT. Birch Run around 640 PM EDT. Mayville around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include East Dayton, Fosters, Watertown, Tuscola, Burt, Juhl, Silverwood and Fostoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Take shelter in a sturdy structure in any thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
